result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey E Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. Must comply with treatment court rules. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.

AMENDED 6/1/2022 to lift stay on 6/1/2022 as the defendant was taken into custody today. Stay will be reinstated on 6/9/2022 at 9am when the defendant is to be released from RCJ. DEFENDANT TO NOT BE ALLOWED HUBER OR TO BE RELEASED FOR ANY REASON.

**AMENDED 6/08/2022 TO REINSTATE STAY ON 6/08/2022**DEFENDANT WILL REMAIN IN CUSTODY ON DOC HOLD.**

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Corey E Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Corey E Jones. Court Reporter: Donna Moore. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Ct 1 GUILTY. 
State consents to jury waiver. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: Ct 1 GUILTY with Cts 2 & 3 being dismissed and read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
4 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 2 years initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed consecutive to any other sentence. 
2 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
180 days Racine County Jail STAYED
Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored by random UA's & breathalyzers & community contacts. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Must comply with treatment court rules.  
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is not eligible for CIP
Defendant is eligible for SAP. 

**NOTE:  Defendant was in custody from 3/20/2022 until 4/13/2022 for a total of 25 days credit for time served.**

records.addlTxt: Atty Juan Ramirez
State's NOI to Intro Expert Testimony
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements

***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
